pages.title: About Me
pages.text: Hi, Welcome to my blog. My name is Eric. I am studying computer science in Queenâ€™s University right now. This blog is used to share daily life and learning experience. posts.title: Port conflict issues between ProtonMail Bridge and ExpressVPN
posts.text: When using ProtonMail Bridge with Thunderbird today, I found that the default imap port 1143 of Bridge conflicted with ExpressVPN, and adjusted it to return to normal. Fault pageï¼š Use the command line netstat -aon|findstr 1143 to locate the PID of the occupied process After that, track the ExpressVPN process through the task manager Therefore, after knowing the reason, ExpressVPN does not support custom ports, and can only be modified to 1149 on the B. After successfully running Thunderbird, the Bridge no longer reports errors. Random thought: Both companies have a counterpart in the VPN business department, and then [enenen.jpg]. . . Reference: How does Win10 check which program occupies the port (Chinese): https://jingyan.baidu.com/article/11c17a2cd35ecef446e39dd8.html
